data: The class and time frame for telemetry monitoring are recommendations. The MRP’s clinical judgement and orders to initiate, suspend, changed or discontinue telemetry takes priority over these recommendations.

•	Acute coronary syndrome – Class I – Up to 24 hours until investigations completed and if no complications noted (i.e., ischemia or arrhythmia)
•	Significant QTc prolongation from medications or metabolic disturbances (i.e. QTc greater than 
450 for men or greater than 470 for women) – Class I - Until QTc returns to baseline and no arrhythmias noted for 12 to 24 hours
•	Acute decompensated heart failure – Class I or II - At least 24 hours with no significant arrhythmias noted
•	Coronary vasospasm– Class I or II - Until definitive therapy initiated and no events for 
12 to 24 hours
•	Recent initiation of medications with high propensity to develop QT prolongation and torsades de pointes (in patients at increased risk) – Class I or II - At discretion of physician, until dose and QTc interval stable without significant arrhythmias, monitoring via serial ECGs are a reasonable alternative
•	Confirmed or Suspected drug overdose with risk of arrhythmias – Class I or II - Until patient clinically stable and no arrhythmias noted for 24 hours
•	Suspected cardiac cause of syncope – Class I or II - At least 24 to 48 hours with no arrhythmias noted
•	Following PCI in patients without MI and without complications – Class II - Until 4 to 6 hours post PCI with no significant arrhythmias noted
•	Atrial dysrhythmias requiring ongoing drug titration – Class II - Until drug dose and rhythm stable
•	Suspected pacemaker malfunction in patient who is not pacemaker dependent – Class II or Holter - Until pacemaker interrogation and definitive management complete
•	Post Stroke (cardiac workup) – Class II or Holter - 24 hours
Both the Indication(s) and Monitoring Type fields need to be completed to initiate telemetry
PLACEHOLDER FOR NEW REMOTE TELEMETRY ORDER

For Class II telemetry monitoring requiring inter-hospital transport consult the most responsible physician for transport orders including whether or not a telemetry trained RN is required for accompaniment.
T;N: if not already in situ
If not done within 12 hour prior to initiating telemetry
